com.qubulus.qps
Class AbstractRssiPositioningService

java.lang.Object
  Service
      com.qubulus.qps.AbstractPositioningService
          com.qubulus.qps.AbstractRssiPositioningService
Direct Known Subclasses:
RemotePositioningService
public abstract class AbstractRssiPositioningService
extends AbstractPositioningService

Base class for positioning service implementations using Wi-Fi and GSM RSSI readings.

Configuration

The following settings can be provided as Android string resources to automatically provide feedback to the end-user if required or optional sensors are disabled.
  • Having the Wi-Fi chipset enabled (whether associated or not) is required for RSSI-based positioning services to work. To display a notification to the user every time the Wi-Fi is disabled while the positioning service is running, the title and the content of the notification must be provided. The notification will not be shown if any of these labels is missing.
    • qps_wifi_notification_title
    • qps_wifi_notification_content
  • From the mobile network, only GSM/2G signals can be used to improve the positioning compared to Wi-Fi only. To display a notification to the user once if the 3G is used while the positioning service is running, the title and the content of the notification must be provided. The notification will not be shown if any of these labels is missing.
    • qps_gsm_notification_title
    • qps_gsm_notification_content

Permissions required

  • android.permission.WAKE_LOCK
  • android.permission.ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION
  • android.permission.CHANGE_WIFI_STATE
  • android.permission.ACCESS_WIFI_STATE
